results.title: Wait until dark
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Mel Ferrer and Terence Young
results.brief_description: Susy is an independent and resourceful housewife learning to cope with her blindness resulted from a recent accident. Susy’s life changes drastically when she is terrorised by a group of criminals who believe she is in possession of a doll used by them to smuggle drugs into the country. Alone and cut off from the world outside, Susy must fight for her life against this group of ruthless criminals. Music by Henry Mancini. Cast includes: Audrey Hepburn, Alan Arkin, Richard Crenna, Eferm Zimbalist Jr. and Jack Weston.

results.title: Waimakariri, river from the snows
results.brief_description: An account of the history of the Waimakariri River in Canterbury Province, New Zealand. Shows attempts at solving such problems as flooding, and soil erosion in the catchment areas. The Waimakariri River Trust is attempting to restore land laid bare by soil erosion. Methods used include the planting of grass and trees on sandy hillslopes and the building of artificial river banks.

results.title: Wagner. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Part two of this major drama production which coincided with the centenary of Richard Wagner’s death. Wagner remains an enigma with his rags-to-riches saga with a fairytale end. He was loved yet hated, admired yet despised, a villain yet a hero. Wagner was worshipped and a man whose fame and exploits were the gossip of Europe. Above all, he was an incurable romantic, whose love affair with Liszt’s illegitimate daughter rivals that of Romeo and Juliet in excitement and drama. This is Wagner’s story - the story of one of the greatest composers who ever lived.

results.title: Wagner. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Wagner - the film is one of the most important independent productions ever attempted, bringing together the talents of some of Britain’s most prominent musical and theatrical names. Music is conducted by Sir Georg Solti and the production stars Richard Burton as Wagner with Vanessa Redgrave, Sir John Gielgud, Sir Ralph Richardson and Sir Laurence Olivier. This is the first in a two part series which chronicles the rags-to-riches saga of Richard Wagner - one of the greatest composers that ever lived.

results.title: Wages of fear = Salaire de peur
results.creator_credit: Vera Films, CICC, Filmsonor (Paris), Fono Roma, Raymond Borderie, Henri-Georges Clouzot and Louis Wipf
results.brief_description: This film runs along the traditional template of any story - a beginning, which unhurriedly and deliberately sets the scene, a middle section that carries the plotline, and a brief ending that resolves everything to no one’s satisfaction. The beginning paints a picture of a world unimaginable to anyone from a developed country, of corruption, poverty, and oppression. It simultaneously describes the main characters - a bunch of immigrants who have strayed to this miserable little town, and for whom there is little chance of escape from the baking heat and unemployment. There is Mario, the happy-go-lucky scrounger, Luigi, his hard-working Italian pal, the comically tyranical tavern owner, his much abused maid, and Jo, the suave and dangerous French gangster. Homosexuality, racism, and the oppression of women figure prominently, but are never commented upon directly, as various prison motifs are evident in the lighting and set construction. Suddenly there is a change - a way out for a ‘lucky’ four of the deadbeats. There has been an explosion at an oil well on the other side of the mountain. The oil company needs to put out the fire with explosives, which are stored in the town. But its nitro-glycerine, and there is no time to get specially-fitted trucks to carry it over the rough mountains roads. Rather than risk their own employees, the oil company offers a large reward to four volunteers. Cue the action as first the men compete for the places on the two trucks, then as the winners embark on their terrifying journey, where every bump could spell instant death. On the journey their true characters emerge. One, Jo, is broken by the ordeal, but is eventually redeemed. ‘How exciting could a simple road trip be?’ you might ask, but the one and a half hour screen journey is petrifyingly spellbinding. Fate seems to be stacked against these bedraggled heroes, but it is their ingenuity, effort and bravery which captures our hearts. In French and Italian with English subtitles.

Suitable for upper secondary level.
